snippet: The decisive victory underlined how the National Front’s tough talk on crime and illegal immigration may be resonating with voters.
abstract: Triumph by far-right National Front party in minor election in south of France creates headlines across the country; prompts politicians and political analysts to take a hard look at landscape,  little more than a year after election of socialist Pres Francois Hollande.

byline.contributor: Maïa de la Baume contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The decisive victory underlined how the National Front’s tough talk on crime and illegal immigration may be resonating with voters.

headline.main: Minor Victory by Far-Right Party Has France Asking if Bigger Changes Are Ahead
headline.print_headline: Minor Victory by Far-Right Party Has France Asking if Bigger Changes Are Ahead
